intro: Thibaudia anomala, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with a contrasting throat. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Thibaudia anomala is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
